user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_GetResourceName:
```c
int32 OS_GetResourceName(osal_id_t object_id, char *buffer, size_t buffer_size)
{
    OS_common_record_t *record;
    int32               return_code;
    size_t              name_len;
    OS_object_token_t   token;

    /* sanity check the passed-in buffer and size */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(buffer);
    OS_CHECK_SIZE(buffer_size);

    /*
     * Initially set the output string to empty.
     * This avoids undefined behavior in case the function fails
     * and the caller does not check the return code.
     */
    buffer[0] = 0;

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, OS_ObjectIdToType_Impl(object_id), object_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        record = OS_ObjectIdGlobalFromToken(&token);

        if (record->name_entry != NULL)
        {
            name_len = OS_strnlen(record->name_entry, buffer_size);
            if (buffer_size <= name_len)
            {
                /* indicates the name does not fit into supplied buffer */
                return_code = OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG;
                name_len    = buffer_size - 1;
            }
            memcpy(buffer, record->name_entry, name_len);
            buffer[name_len] = 0;
        }

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_GetResourceName:
typedef struct OS_common_record OS_common_record_t
...
OS_common_record_t *OS_ObjectIdGlobalFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    uint32 base_idx = OS_GetBaseForObjectType(token->obj_type);
    return &OS_common_table[base_idx + token->obj_idx];
}
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_lock_mode_t lock_mode, osal_objtype_t idtype, osal_id_t id, OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    int32 return_code;

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit(lock_mode, idtype, token);
    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return return_code;
    }

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex(idtype, id, &token->obj_idx);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        token->obj_id = id;

        /*
         * The "ConvertToken" routine will return with the global lock
         * in a state appropriate for returning to the caller, as indicated
         * by the "check_mode" parameter.
         *
         * Note If this operation fails, then it always unlocks the global for
         * all check_mode's other than NONE.
         */
        return_code = OS_ObjectIdConvertToken(token);
    }

    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel(token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
void OS_ObjectIdRelease(OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_ObjectIdTransactionFinish(token, NULL);
}
...
static inline size_t OS_strnlen(const char *s, size_t maxlen)
{
    const char *end = (const char *)memchr(s, 0, maxlen);
    if (end != NULL)
    {
        /* actual length of string is difference */
        maxlen = end - s;
    }
    return maxlen;
}
...
#define OS_CHECK_POINTER(ptr) BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,OS_INVALID_POINTER)
...
#define OS_CHECK_SIZE(val) ARGCHECK((val)>0&&(val)<(UINT32_MAX/2),OS_ERR_INVALID_SIZE)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The remaining pointer usages in the provided code are not flagged because they are either clearly intended for modification/output or are already const-qualified: - The 'buffer' parameter in OS_GetResourceName is an output buffer that the function writes into, so it must not be const. - The 'token' argument passed to OS_ObjectIdGetById and OS_ObjectIdRelease is used for transaction/state operations (modified by those functions), so it should not be const. - OS_ObjectIdGetById/OS_ObjectIdRelease and the related transaction functions take pointer parameters that are used to return or update state; these pointers are therefore expected to be non-const. - The helper OS_strnlen already takes a const char * (correctly const-qualified). - The macro checks (OS_CHECK_POINTER, OS_CHECK_SIZE) and other non-pointer scalar parameters are not relevant to pointer const-qualification. Thus only the listed fragments (uses/definitions of the record pointer, the OS_ObjectIdGlobalFromToken return, and uses of record->name_entry) need investigation to determine whether those pointers/fields/return types could or should be const-qualified under MISRA C Rule 8.13.
